meta.message: Personalized list of potential causes for psoriasis based on user profile and evidence-based considerations.

potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Consider managing stress and emotional wellbeing.
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Stress can trigger or worsen psoriasis outbreaks, especially in young adults who often experience active lifestyle and emotional challenges.

potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Evaluate and improve your diet to support skin health.
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Dietary choices, such as high processed foods or food sensitivities, may influence inflammation and skin conditions like psoriasis.

potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Aim for consistent, restorative sleep to help manage psoriasis symptoms.
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Poor sleep quality and irregular sleep schedules can affect immune function and skin health, potentially aggravating psoriasis.

potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Use moisturizers and avoid skin irritants.
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Physical skin irritation, dryness, or harsh skin products can contribute to psoriasis flare-ups.

potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Incorporate gentle physical activity to reduce stress and improve circulation.
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Sedentary lifestyle and physical inactivity may influence immune regulation and skin health.

potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Monitor and minimize exposure to environmental irritants and weather changes.
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Factors like cold, dry air or pollutants can trigger skin conditions such as psoriasis in sensitive individuals.

potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Manage overall health and stress to support immune balance.
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Hormonal fluctuations and immune system activity are known to influence psoriasis severity and frequency.
